commentary.line: Until tomorrow, this is Sidhant Maheshwari, signing off on behalf of Raju, Krishna, Sriram, Bharath and my co-commentator, Ramakrishnan. Bye folks, See you tomorrow!
So, that brings us to the end of our coverage of this game. Tomorrow, Hyderabad lock horns with Rajasthan in Vizag. Don't forget to join us then.
Let's take a look at some of the best tweets from this game
@G_Rajaraman: Don't think PUN handled the defence of 165 well at all. But credit to Mayank and Yuvraj for building on their spinners' good for work.
@bhogleharsha: When he bats like this, there are few more attractive players than @YUVSTRONG12. Taking #DelhiDelhi home #PepsiIPL
@cricketwallah: Two significant gains for Delhi from today's match: Yuvraj back in sizzling form, and self belief to win hopefully restored...
@cricketaakash: The secret to #PUN's success was posting an above-par score...not happening this year...play an extra bowler. Shardul/Karanveer/Golwalkar!
@RusselArnold69: Happy for @DelhiDelhi they needed this win.. Good job fellows snapping the losing streak..a team to watch out for in this competition
@sanjaymanjrekar: Key moment in the game: Yuvi not getting out to Mitchell Johnson. After that the man with the best bat flow in the game takes DEL home.

Mayank Agarwal: 'Very delighted and I am extremely happy. I want to thank my team and the people who are helping us. The plan was to keep wickets in hand and see off the new ball. We knew Punjab takes a lot of wickets up front and the plan was to not lose wickets at the start as Punjab really attacks with the new ball. We repeated the treble (playing for Karnataka), winning games and winning tournaments is what we all play for. We have momentum on our side. In the first two games as well, we couldn't close out on the game, but we did it today.'
Mayank Agarwal is the Man of the Match for his 48-ball 68

Duminy: 'It's been 12 games. Pretty pleased with the performance. You could see the tentativeness in the back part of the innings. There are not many bowlers in the world who can be on top of him when he's in that kind of form (on Yuvraj's performance). He was really good, he did brilliantly today. We always knew that the spinners will be the most difficult to face in the end.'

Bailey: 'I thought we had enough. We didn't bat, field or bowl well enough. You need to do well in at least 2 out of 3 disciplines and we didn't do it. Our batters got runs, but there were no particular partnerships as such. You saw what a 100-run parternship does and the Delhi got it. Everytime, we started getting mometum, we lost a wicket. David (Miller) is versatile enough and it doesn't matter that how you strike the ball, but you need to bat according to the situation (talking about the batting order). We put down 2-3 chances as well. In these games, there is no point having a team bat till the 18th over and having 2 or 3 down, you need to take wickets up front. Quite happy with the way we fought it out. The boys came back and did well towards the end'

The Punjab camp would be disappointed with the fact that they lost their way a bit after Virender Sehwag and Wriddhiman Saha had strung together an enterprising partnership. For Delhi, if Amit Mishra and Nathan Coulter-Nile put the brakes on the scoring rate, then Imran Tahir made a sterling comeback in the end overs to snare three wickets.

Yuvraj Singh unfurled a series of sparkling shots to help Delhi win their first game of this year's tournament. In fact, this was Delhi's first win after losing 11 games in a row in the IPL. Mayank Agarwal too played a key role with a handy innings. Earlier, after Shreyas Iyer was dismissed by Sandeep Sharma, the partnership between Duminy and Agarwal was taking sizeable proportions. Unfortunately for them, Duminy was run out. However, Yuvraj and Agarwal played with resolve. Yuvraj reached his fifty in style by flicking Anureet for a six. It got a bit tense in the end, but Delhi eventually won the game with one ball to spare.

The players walk off the field after shaking hands. Duminy is delighted to finally have a win under his belt. The Delhi are all smiles as they come out to shake hands with their counterparts. Even Gary Kirsten applauds his team's efforts.

Well, it's time to focus back on the game today. Will DEL win their first game today after 11 successive losses? Only time will tell. For now, PUN players are walking out to the middle after breaking out of the huddle. The Delhi' openers also make their way out on the field.
It's a big blow for Mumbai, who are already struggling at the bottom of the points table. This will only make it worse for them. Lendl Simmons will probably take his place in the playing XI now.
Aaron Finch has tweeted: Looks like I'll be out of the rest of @IPL at this stage! The scan showed a bit of damage, absolutely shattered!

Mathews: 'We can take the momentum. The bowlers came back really well. After the start, we had to take wickets and we did that. Great effort from the bowling unit. It's a little two-paced (talking about the pitch), but 165 is about par and we need to bat well. We don't need to put a lot of pressure on ourselves and not lose wickets in the beginnning. We can then chase it down in the later half of the innings.'

Once Sehwag was dismissed, the jam-packed stadium roused to life as Glenn Maxwell and George Bailey landed a few handy blows. For Delhi, Nathan Coulter-Nile and Amit Mishra put up a concerted effort to pull the batting side back early on in the innings. JP Duminy took the crucial wickets of Sehwag and David Miller. The deck is good for batting and Delhi will look to overhaul the target.

Virender Sehwag and Wriddhiman Saha played fluent knocks as Punjab posted a competitive total. In fact, they had an early hiccup, as Murali Vijay was dismissed by Angelo Mathews. However, they recovered on the back of Sehwag and Saha stitching a fine partnership. If Sehwag played lofted shots down the ground and showed good wrist-work to smartly guide it through third-man, then Saha hoicked it across the line to crack a couple of sixes. Sehwag even took on the key spinner in the opposition ranks, Imran Tahir, to crunch two boundaries and a six in a single over.

4.1   Mathews to Sehwag, FOUR, poor ball from Mathews first up. You can't give width to Sehwag, it was in his zone and he cuts it uppishly over backward point for a boundary
Angelo Mathews, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack

The ball gets deflected off the pad and rolls past the leg stump and to the right of the keeper, he could have dragged it back on the stumps, but survives

3.1   Joseph to Vijay, 2 runs, Vijay backs away yet again and goes for the loft, he doesn't get it off the middle of the bat and ends up slicing it. Luckily, the ball went over the fielder at cover and the batsmen take two before the ball is hunted down

2.5   Coulter-Nile to Sehwag, no run, another play and miss! Sehwag is struggling to get his bat on ball here, it was slightly wide outside off, Sehwag has a waft at it, but fails to connect yet again

2.3   Coulter-Nile to Sehwag, no run, back of a length delivery angling in on the stumps, Sehwag was caught in the crease there, but did well to block it towards mid-off after hopping a little

Vijay and Sehwag are at the crease. Vijay is on strike. Coulter-Nile will open the attack

The Delhi get into a huddle as the umpires make their way out. Murali Vijay is walking out to the middle, followed by Sehwag. Vijay will take the strike first up. Coulter-Nile will start the proceedings with the ball. There are two slips in place.
Teams:
Delhi (Playing XI): Mayank Agarwal, Shreyas Iyer, Jean-Paul Duminy(c), Yuvraj Singh, Manoj Tiwary, Angelo Mathews, Kedar Jadhav(w), Nathan Coulter-Nile, Amit Mishra, Imran Tahir, Domnic Joseph
Punjab (Playing XI): Virender Sehwag, Murali Vijay, Wriddhiman Saha(w), Glenn Maxwell, David Miller, George Bailey(c), Axar Patel, Mitchell Johnson, Rishi Dhawan, Anureet Singh, Sandeep Sharma
Punjab have won the toss and have opted to bat

Duminy: 'Probably 85 percent of the game, we were winning it (talking about the previous game). On a whole, we were happy with our performances. Hopefully, we can go one better today. We need to get points on the board. We were pretty happy with our bowling in the first game and our batting in the second game. Hopefully, we can deliver today. We probably would have batted as well. It's a short format and the wicket shouldn't change much. Just one change for us, Domnic Joseph comes in for Jaydev Unadkat. Hopefully, we can restrict them to a decent score and chase it down.'

Bailey: 'Everything was pretty good the other night. We haven't quite clicked with our batting. We need to put up good partnerships. We've got options and it's nice that we don't get too predictable (talking about the team's bowling). We've been busy. It's nice to have one down day, relax a bit and train a little. We are having a bat. It's a different wicket from the last game. The toss is not that important. We have the same team.'
Stay tuned for the toss and the teams.

Weather Report: There are a few clouds in the sky, but hopefully rain will stay away from the MCA Stadium. It's a little breezy out there as well. With temperatures expected to stay under 30 degrees Celsius, it should be a good evening for cricket.
Head-to-Head: Both teams have played each other on 14 occasions prior to today's game, with PUN winning 9 of those games. On the other hand, the Delhi have won 5 matches against them.

PUN too have a few worries of their own. The Big Show - Glenn Maxwell, has failed to fire in the first two games. In fact, he has failed to even reach double digits in both those innings. Batting at a crucial number 3 position, it will be a worry for the team management if Maxwell fails to get some runs under his belt in this game as well. However, the form of Sandeep Sharma with the new ball, has surprised and delighted one and all. He has continued from where he left off in last year's IPL. His inswing has posed a lot of threat for the batters up front in the two games so far.

Today, the Delhi will look to change all that and get on the points table. Yuvraj Singh, who was bought for 16 crores in the auction has failed to justify his price till now. Even though he has looked good in both his brief stays, he has been guilty of throwing his wicket away when the team needed him to go on and score big. The Delhi have also been hampered by the unavailability of Mohammed Shami and Zaheer Khan as both of them are still recovering from their respective injuries.

Their rivals today, Delhi, have failed to register a single win so far this season. The Delhi have now extended their losing streak to 11 games in the IPL, after they lost their final 9 games in 2014. Even though the team wears a new look, they have struggled to break the shackles this time around as well. They have lost both their games off the very last ball of the match. They are doing a number of things right, but they have failed to hold their nerves when it mattered the most.

18:45 Local Time, 13:15 GMT, 18:45 IST: After losing their first game against Rajasthan, Punjab came back strongly to win their second game against the Mumbai. Even though they managed to win the game by 18 runs in the end, their bowling came under serious pressure when Harbhajan and Suchith were smacking them all over the park. PUN bowlers had Mumbai reeling at 59/6 after 13.4 overs, but what came afterwards blew them away. Both Harbhajan and Suchith added 100 runs in just 35 deliveries, making a mockery of the bowling attack and showing us how quickly things can change in T20.

Preview

Delhi go into their Indian Premier League 2015 game against Punjab in Pune on Wednesday, one defeat short of the embarrassing record of having the worst losing streak in IPL history. They are currently tied with Pune India, having suffered 11 defeats, and will need a mammoth effort against last-year's finalists to break their duck.

Delhi, who went through major overhauls two years in-a-row, missed golden opportunities in their first two games to record a much-needed win losing by one run to Chennai and slipping a dominant position against Rajasthan. They will be hoping that they are now better-equipped at handling pressure situations and come out on top.

On the contrary, George Bailey's side overcame a disappointing start to the season by beating Mumbai in their own backyard on Sunday. Punjab will hope to further consolidate their place in the top half of the table with another win.

Venue: Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium, Pune

Date: April 15, 2015

Time: 2000 IST

Weather: Temperature around the mid-20s. Partly cloudy.

Team news:

Punjab:

Bailey and coach Sanjay Bangar have no need to tinker with the winning combination. They will most likely go in with the side that beat Mumbai. Rishi Dhawan, who was brought in for Karanveer Singh following the latter's less-than-impressive display in the first game, will be a slight worry since he failed with both bat and ball against Mumbai.

Punjab will count on a strong display by diminutive Wriddhiman Saha. The wicket-keeper batsman was played at No. 3 in the first game but had to make way for Glenn Maxwell, David Miller and company when they enjoyed a solid start in Mumbai on Sunday. Maxwell has not had an innings of note and the team will expect him to start firing soon.

Probable XI: Virender Sehwag, Murali Vijay, Wriddhiman Saha (wicket-keeper), Glenn Maxwell, David Miller, George Bailey (captain), Axar Patel, Mitchell Johnson, Rishi Dhawan, Anureet Singh and Sandeep Sharma.

Delhi:

Two games, two last-over finishes and a losing streak of 11 games. Despite the unenviable statistic, they just to get just the final piece of the jigsaw to find winning ways. A return to a more conventional batting order against Rajasthan bore dividends and now the team would hope that the bowling clicks into gear. The Indian pace duo of Mohammed Shami and Zaheer Khan are nursing injuries from before the season and will miss another game. If he is fit, the relatively unknown Dominic Joseph may regain his place in the XI ahead of Jaydev Unadkat.

Probable XI: Mayank Agarwal, Shreyas Iyer, JP Duminy (captain), Yuvraj Singh, Angelo Mathews, Saurabh Tiwary/Manoj Tiwary, Kedar Jadhav (wicket-keeper), Nathan Coulter-Nile, Amit Mishra, Imran Tahir, Dominic Joseph Muthuswamy/Jaydev Unadkat.

Quotes:

Failure and success are parts of the game. My role in the Punjab team is to go hard at the ball and that's what I'll do every single time I walk out in the middle

- Glenn Maxwell, on why he would not change his approach to batting

He is a world-class spinner and I have a lot of respect for him. It is great to bowl alongside him. We discuss variations, conditions and spin and it has been good.

- Imran Tahir, on his partnership with fellow leg-spinner Amit Mishra
